description: Alberta’s government plans to directly dedicate barrels of oil for new pipeline projects in a bid to accelerate the expansion of production in the western Canadian province.
title: Alberta Looks to Spur New Pipelines by Guaranteeing Barrels

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economic statecraft reporter Daniel Flatley looks at how Donald Trump uses his favorite tool: the tariff threat. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Keeps His Options Open in Wielding the Tariff Tool

description: President-elect Donald Trump took to Truth Social on Monday to deny a report that he might moderate plans for across-the-board tariffs when he retakes the White House, fanning uncertainty about one of the most hotly anticipated policy moves he’s set to make.
title: Trump Keeps World Guessing Over How He Intends to Impose Tariffs

description: Donald Trump Jr. will travel to Greenland this week in a surprise visit to the Arctic territory, just weeks after his father, US President-elect Donald Trump, rekindled the idea of buying the island from Denmark.
title: Trump Jr. Plans Surprise Greenland Visit After Talk of US Purchase

description: Justin Trudeau said Monday that he will leave as Canada’s prime minister in the coming months, ending a political run that included three consecutive election victories and nine years in the country’s highest political office.
title: Carney, Freeland Lead List of Contenders to Succeed Trudeau as Canada’s PM

description: Congress certified Donald Trump’s presidential election victory Monday without dispute and with his defeated Democratic opponent Kamala Harris presiding, resuming a ritual of democracy four years after a mob attack on the US Capitol marred the vote count with violence.
title: Trump Declared Election Winner in Ceremony Four Years After Riot

description: Giorgia Meloni was in Mar-a-Lago for barely five hours and every moment had to count. With so many leaders vying for Donald Trump’s attention, hers was a win. But after dinner with the president elect, she was sat down to a screening of a controversial documentary on John Eastman, a Trump ally who formed a plan to overturn the results of the 2020 election.
title: Meloni’s Closeness to Musk and Trump Is a Win-Win — and a Big Risk

description: French President Emmanuel Macron warned that Iran’s nuclear program is on a potentially irreversible course, nearing a point of no return.
title: Macron Warns Iran’s Nuclear Program Close to Point of No Return

description: Namibia, one of the world’s largest uranium producers, is seeking investment from China in nuclear power to boost its role in the global push to clean energy.
title: Namibia Seeks Investment in Nuclear Power From China

description: The Canadian dollar advanced after Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced his resignation as head of the Liberal Party, triggering a contest to replace him as leader.
title: Loonie Gains as Wall Street Weighs In on Trudeau’s Resignation

description: Here are the key takeaways from Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s announcement Monday in Ottawa that he was stepping down as leader of the Liberal Party:
title: Key Takeaways From Trudeau’s Resignation as Party Leader

description: TikTok creators are posting videos promoting ways to get around a looming shutdown of the app in the US, which could spell trouble for Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc.’s Google and other American tech companies required by law to enforce the ban or risk potentially billions in fines.
title: TikTok Ban Thrusts Apple, Google Into US-China Geopolitical Fray

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is resigning after more than nine years leading Canada, bowing to sagging approval numbers and a rebellion within his political party.
title: Trudeau Resigns After Nine Years in Power as Liberals Force Him Out

description: Justin Trudeau Photographer: Dave Chan/Getty Images
title: Trudeau Says ‘Parliament Needs a Reset, to Calm Down’

description: Senior politicians in three of Britain’s biggest parties have privately urged Donald Trump’s allies to reconsider his relationship with Elon Musk, after the billionaire Tesla boss made a series of increasingly inflammatory remarks about UK politics, including endorsing a figure on the far right.
title: UK Parties Unite in Urging Trump to Rethink Musk’s Meddling

description: Britain’s government has been pushed onto the defensive by comments from Elon Musk accusing Prime Minister Keir Starmer of complicity in a decades-old scandal over child sexual exploitation gangs.
title: Why Musk Waded Into UK Child Grooming Gangs Scandal

description: Donald Trump asked a New York appeals court to stop his hush money sentencing set for Jan. 10 while the president-elect tries again to overturn his guilty verdict ahead of his inauguration.
title: Trump Asks NY Appeals Court to Stop Hush Money Sentencing

description: President-elect Donald Trump denies a Washington Post report that he would consider applying a tariff to all countries but be limited to specific critical imports.
title: Trump Says His Tariff Policy Won’t Be Pared Back

description: The European Union said it will closely monitor whether Elon Musk’s upcoming interview with German far-right leader Alice Weidel on his X social media network runs afoul of its content moderation rules.
title: EU to Watch How X Treats Musk Event With German Far-Right Leader

description: Punta del Este is becoming a magnet for foreign money in Uruguay. Health, real estate and airport projects are underway as a result.
title: Wealth Managers Flock to South American Beach Haven for the Rich

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he retains confidence in his City minister, Tulip Siddiq, who has come under scrutiny over her ties to properties linked to allies of Bangladesh’s ousted former government.
title: Starmer Backs City Minister Tulip Siddiq Amid Property Scrutiny

description: Austria’s far-right leader Herbert Kickl received a mandate from President Alexander Van der Bellen to form a government, putting the Freedom Party chief one step closer to becoming chancellor.
title: Austria Far-Right Nears Historic Rule With Path to Form Cabinet

description: Aides to President-elect Donald Trump are considering a tariff plan that would apply to all countries but be limited to specific critical imports, the Washington Post reported, citing three people familiar with the discussions who it didn’t identify.
title: Trump Team Mulls Narrowing Universal Tariffs, Post Reports

description: The US is finalizing steps to remove longstanding barriers to civil nuclear cooperation with India as the two countries look to bolster relations further.
title: US, India Make Progress On Civil Nuclear Deal, Sullivan Says

description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping said his country must prevail in the fight against graft, signaling that he’ll remain focused on rooting out dirty officials in 2025.
title: Xi Says China Must Win ‘Tough, Protracted’ Fight Against Graft

description: Keir Starmer condemned Elon Musk’s barrage of social media posts attacking his UK government, in his strongest response yet amid an escalating row with the billionaire Donald Trump ally that risks damaging relations between Britain and the US.
title: Starmer Says Musk Attacks on UK Mean Line Has Been Crossed

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Austrian Far Right Shakes Europe’s Mainstream

description: Hamas has named 34 hostages, some of them believed to have died in captivity, who it says it would return to Israel in the first phase of an evolving if still elusive ceasefire in Gaza.
title: Hamas Names Hostages It May Return But Deal With Israel Elusive

description: South Africa must invest 200 billion rand ($11 billion) to revive its frayed railways, half that amount again to upgrade water infrastructure, and tackle bottlenecks in both electricity and governance to achieve an economic growth target above 3% a year.
title: Infrastructure Reform Key to Lift South Africa Growth, BER Says

description: French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said the 2025 budget will aim narrow the deficit to between 5% and 5.5% of economic output.
title: France Signals Deficit as Wide as 5.5% to Avoid Hurting Economy

description: It may go against the grain to work with former jihadists, but Western countries can have little leverage without first lifting sanctions.
title: Syria's New Leader Deserves US Help — But Not Its Trust

description: President Joe Biden said he’s determined to peacefully hand over power later this month, while warning against efforts to downplay the violent mob assault on the US Capitol that sought to prevent certification of his own election four years ago.
title: Biden to Attend Trump Inauguration In Bid to Restore Traditions of Peaceful Transition of Power

description: Taiwan suspects that a Chinese-owned cargo vessel damaged an undersea cable near its northeastern coast on Friday, in an alleged act of sabotage that highlights the vulnerabilities of Taipei’s offshore communications infrastructure.
title: Taiwan Says Chinese Ship Broke Subsea Cable in Alleged Sabotage

description: Thailand’s inflation returned to the central bank’s target range for the first time in seven months, giving monetary authorities scope to fend off government calls for more rate cuts as global uncertainties mount.
title: Thai Inflation Returns to Target for First Time in Seven Months

description: China’s efforts to entice more Taiwanese people to get permits to live and work on the mainland is prompting concern in Taipei that Beijing could be laying the groundwork to justify intervention in the self-governing island’s affairs, according to a senior Taiwanese official.
title: China Enticing Taiwanese to Live There Stirs Concern in Taipei

description: Up to 300 Afghan nationals seeking to resettle in the US arrived in the Philippines on Monday to process their visas, part of an earlier agreement between Manila and Washington.
title: Afghans Seeking US Immigrant Visas Arrive in the Philippines

description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak stepped up efforts to serve the rest of his prison sentence for corruption at home, submitting to a court in Putrajaya what he says is a copy of a royal decree permitting him to do so.
title: Former Malaysia Leader Najib Steps Up Campaign for House Arrest

description: The Biden administration is set to offer limited sanctions relief to Syria to boost the flow of humanitarian aid in the aftermath of President Bashar al-Assad’s downfall, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Set to Allow For More Humanitarian Aid to Flow to Syria

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken expressed confidence in South Korea’s acting leader as the two nations reaffirmed their security alliance in the face of the ongoing challenges posed by North Korea at a time when Seoul is struggling to restore political stability.
title: Blinken Says Confident in South Korea’s Acting Leadership

description: North Korea fired a suspected ballistic missile Monday, Japan’s coast guard said, ratcheting up tensions in the region as political turmoil continues in neighboring South Korea.
title: North Korea Launches Suspected Ballistic Missile, Japan Says

description: The Venezuela opposition leader the US has recognized as president-elect met President Joe Biden just days before Donald Trump takes over in Washington and faces his own decision about how to handle relations with a country that’s a major source of undocumented immigrants.
title: Venezuela Challenger Meets Biden, Putting Pressure on Trump

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on Monday announced a A$7.2 billion ($4.5 billion) funding to upgrade a highway in opposition-controlled Queensland, fueling speculation that national elections may be announced soon.
title: Australia PM Unveils $4.5 Billion Highway Upgrade as Polls Loom

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is expected to announce his resignation as leader of the Liberal Party this week, the Globe and Mail reported, citing information from three people it didn’t name.
title: Canada’s Trudeau Is Likely to Resign This Week, Globe Says

description: South Korean investigators have asked police to execute a warrant to arrest President Yoon Suk Yeol after their initial attempt last week ended in failure following an hours-long standoff with his security team.
title: South Korean Corruption Watchdog Asks Police to Arrest Yoon

description: Global central bankers are poised to cut borrowing costs further in 2025, but only warily — and with a keen eye on the policies of incoming US President Donald Trump.
title: Trump Haunts Central Banks Primed for Wary Rate Cuts in 2025
